sections.heading: Impersonating a decorated military veteran.
sections.text:
718B.1 Impersonating a decorated military veteran.

A person who impersonates a decorated military veteran with the intent to deceive another person for the purpose of gaining any real or anticipated monetary gain commits a seriousmisdemeanor. For the purposes of this section,

“decorated military veteran”

means a veteranof the armed forces of the United States who has been awarded any decoration or medalauthorized by the United States Congress for service in the armed forces of the United States,any of the service medals or badges awarded to the members of such forces, or the ribbon,button, or rosette of any such badge, decoration, or medal. 2011 Acts, ch 96, §1 Sat Dec 23 12:31:15 2023 Iowa Code 2024, Section 718B.1 (15, 0)
